Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for the Virtual WAN setup, including bandwidth, latency, redundancy, and security needs. Identify the applications and services that will use Virtual WAN.
Design the network architecture, including hub locations, connections, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure networks.
Provision the Virtual WAN resource in the Azure portal, ensuring proper configuration of hubs and regions.
Set up virtual hubs within the Virtual WAN, including routing, security policies, and connectivity options.
Enable security features such as Azure Firewall, Network Security Groups (NSGs), and DDoS Protection within the Virtual WAN setup.
Connect on-premises networks, branch offices, and remote users to the Virtual WAN using VPN or ExpressRoute connections.
Set up routing policies to manage traffic flow between hubs, branches, and Azure resources.
Perform thorough testing of the Virtual WAN setup, including failover scenarios, throughput tests, and latency measurements.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and Network Watcher to track Virtual WAN performance and connectivity status.
Document the Virtual WAN setup, including architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Share documentation with relevant teams.
Ensure the Virtual WAN setup meets regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Conduct training sessions for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting the Virtual WAN setup. Offer ongoing support as needed.
